title: After learning the filtered deck, the "empty" button is replaced by the "undo" button, and this button does not respond when clicked
body:
###### Description

"Filtered Deck" originally contains a "rebuild" function and "empty" function, but when you finish a filtered deck the "empty" button disappears and is replaced by an invalid button "undo".

###### Reproduction Steps

1. click "more option"
2. click "create filtered deck"
3. enter a name "test"
4. click "ok"
5. back
6. click "Clear" to clear the words you need to learn
7. Click "rebuild"
8. Click on the "study"
9. Finish studying
10. Click on the "test"
11. Click "rebuild"
12. The "empty" button is replaced by the "undo" button, which does not respond when clicked

###### Expected Result

the invalid button should not be in place of the "empty" button

###### Actual Result

After learning the filtered deck, the "empty" button is replaced by the "undo" button, and this button does not respond when clicked

###### Debug info
AnkiDroid Version = 2.16alpha63
Android Version = 11
Manufacturer = OnePlus
Model = KB2000
Hardware = qcom
Webview User Agent = Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 11; KB2000 Build/RP1A.201005.001; wv) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0 Chrome/99.0.4844.88 Mobile Safari/537.36
ACRA UUID = 32ebdbb2-6391-4ee3-b87d-c933ecae7006
Scheduler = std2
Crash Reports Enabled = true
DatabaseV2 Enabled = true

###### Research
*Enter an [x] character to confirm the points below:*

- [x] I have read the [support page](https://ankidroid.org/docs/help.html) and am reporting a bug or enhancement request specific to AnkiDroid
- [x] I have checked the [manual](https://ankidroid.org/docs/manual.html) and the [FAQ](https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/wiki/FAQ) and could not find a solution to my issue
- [x] I have searched for similar existing issues here and on the user forum
- [x] (Optional) I have confirmed the issue is not resolved in the latest alpha release ([instructions](https://docs.ankidroid.org/manual.html#betaTesting))
